DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) server information including the physical location of the switch, the organization responsible for the network, SNMP engine identification, trap status and the agent addresses, if configured. SNMP engine identification is derived from the device MAC address on an initial boot.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to view global SNMP server information.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show snmp-server
Location : Lab1, Rack-10 Contact : Broadcom Support EngineID : 8000013703525400f6817e Traps : enable
Agent Addresses:
IP Address UDP Port Interface --------------------------------------- -------- -------------------------------- 1.2.3.4 161 1.2.3.4 1024 1.2.3.5 1024 Ethernet10

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays the SNMP communities configured on the switch and the community group association, if configured. Communities are used by SNMPv2 protocol to access the switch.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to view the configured SNMP communities.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show snmp-server community
Community Name Group Name -------------------------------- -------------------------------- comm1 group-lab comm2 None

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays the SNMP groups configured on the switch. The model and security information indicate the SNMP protocol and security level used to access the system via the group. View names indicate the view that a group provides read, write or trap access to.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to view the configured SNMP groups.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show snmp-server group
Group Name Model: Security Read View Write View Notify View ---------------- -------------------- ---------------- ---------------- ---------------- group-floor1 v2c: no-auth-no-priv ro_view wr_view None group-floor2 v3 : auth-priv r_view None None group-lab v2c: no-auth-no-priv None None None

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays the SNMPv3 users configured on the switch including any authentication and/or encryption algorithm for the user. The group name indicates a group that defines the SNMPv3 access parameters.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to view the configured SNMPv3 users.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show snmp-server user
User Name Group Name Auth Privacy -------------------------------- -------------------------------- ----- ------- user1 group-lab md5 aes-128 user2 group-floor2 None None

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays the SNMP views configured on the switch including the OID tree that the view includes or excludes.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to view the configured SNMP views.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays the SNMP hosts to which the trap or inform messages are sent by the SNMP agent. Timeout indicates the number of seconds before the traps/informs time out when sending to a host. Retries indicate the number of times the traps/informs are sent after timing out.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to view the configured SNMP hosts.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show snmp-server host
Target Address Type Community Ver T-Out Retries --------------------------------------- ------ -------------- --- ----- ------- 1.2.3.4 trap comm1 v2c 15 3
Target Address Type User Name Security T-Out Retries --------------------------------------- ------ -------------- --------------- ----- ------- 1001::1 inform user1 auth-priv 200 10

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure the physical location of the switch.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the SNMP server location information.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server location "Lab1, Rack-10"

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure the contact information about the organization responsible for the network.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the SNMP server contact information.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server contact "Broadcom Support"

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enable the SNMP authentication flag on the switch. The flag is disabled by default.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the SNMP authentication flag.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server enable trap

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure the SNMP engine identification on the local device. It is a hexadecimal string used for localizing configuration. The default engine ID is derived from the device MAC address.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the SNMP engine ID.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server engine 8100013703525400abcd

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure one or more SNMP agent addresses and optionally set the UDP port number on which the SNMP server listens for requests, and the Virtual Routing and Forwarding (VRF) interface used by the management station to access SNMP. The default UDP port is 161.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure an SNMP agent address, UDP port number, and VRF interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP agent address using the default UDP port number.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server agentaddress 1.2.3.4

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP agent address specifying a non-default UDP port number.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server agentaddress 1.2.3.4 port 1024

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP agent address specifying a non-default UDP port number and a VRF interface.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server agentaddress 1.2.3.5 port 1024 interface Ethernet10

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure one or more SNMP communities and optionally associate them with a group.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure an SNMP community and group.

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP community without specifying a group.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server community comm1

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP community and associate it with a group.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server community comm1 group group-lab

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure one or more SNMPv2c and SNMPv3 access groups and optionally set the views which the group uses for the GET/SET requests and to send traps. Authentication and privacy can be set for SNMPv3 groups only. Groups are used when configuring SNMP communities and users.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure an SNMP access group.

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP group that can only access via SNMPv2c without associating it with a view.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server group group1 v2c

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP group that can only access via SNMPv2c associating it with a view for only sending out traps.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server group group1 v2c notify no_view

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP group that can only access via SNMPv3 specifying the security level and without associating it with a view.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server group group-floor2 v3 priv

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP group that can only access via SNMPv3 associating it with the views for the GET/SET requests and sending out traps.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server group group-floor2 v3 priv read r_view write w_view notify n_view

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure one or more SNMPv3 users and optionally set the authentication and group association. Authentication passwords can be encrypted. If password encryption is desired, it must be specified prior to setting the authentication type.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure an SNMPv3 user.

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMPv3 user without authentication and group association.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server user user1

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMPv3 user without authentication associating it with a group.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server user user1 group group-lab

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMPv3 user specifying authentication and group association.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server user user1 group group-lab auth md5 auth-password pwd priv aes-128 priv-password pwd

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMPv3 user specifying encrypted authentication and group association.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server user user2 group group-floor2 encrypted auth sha auth-password abcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcd priv des priv-password abcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcdabcd

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure one or more SNMP views and set the OID tree to include or exclude from the view. SNMP views are used by the groups for the GET/SET requests and to send traps.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure a SNMP view.

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP view that excludes the OID tree.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server view view2 1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8.9.2 excluded

COMMAND.name: snmp-server host
COMMAND.help: Configure SNMP Host for Traps or Notifications

PARAM.name: time-out
PARAM.help: Inform acknowledgement timeout period in seconds

PARAM.name: retry
PARAM.help: Number of retry attempts per inform

PARAM.name: time-out
PARAM.help: Inform acknowledgement timeout period in seconds

PARAM.name: retry
PARAM.help: Number of retry attempts per inform

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure one or more SNMP IPv4 or IPv6 hosts to which the trap or inform messages are sent to by the SNMP agent. Optionally set the timeout and number of retries for the inform messages sent to a host. Timeout indicates the number of seconds before the informs time out when sending to a host. Retries indicate the number of times the informs are sent after timing out.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure an SNMP host.

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP IPv4 host community to receive SNMPv2c traps.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server host 1.2.3.4 community comm1 traps v2c

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP IPv4 host user to receive SNMPv3 informs without authentication specifying the timeout and number of retries.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server host 1.2.3.5 user user1 informs noauth timeout 200 retries 10

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP IPv6 host community to receive SNMPv2c informs without authentication specifying the timeout and number of retries.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server host 2001::1 community comm2 informs timeout 150 retries 5

EXAMPLE.summary: Add an SNMP IPv6 host user to receive SNMPv3 traps with authentication and privacy.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# snmp-server host 3001::1 user u1 traps priv

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Clear the physical location of the switch.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to clear the SNMP server location information.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server location

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Clear the contact information about the organization responsible for the network.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to clear the SNMP server contact information.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server contact

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disable the SNMP authentication flag on the switch.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to disable the SNMP authentication flag.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server enable trap

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete the configured SNMP engine identification on the local device.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to delete the configured SNMP engine ID.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server engine

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete a configured SNMP agent address specifying any optionally set UDP port number and/or the VRF interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to delete an SNMP agent address.

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP agent address that uses the default UDP port.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server agentaddress 1.2.3.4

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP agent address and the non-default UDP port it uses.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server agentaddress 1.2.3.4 port 1024

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP agent address including the non-default UDP port and VRF interface it uses.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server agentaddress 1.2.3.5 port 1024 interface Ethernet10

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete a configured SNMP community.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to delete an SNMP community.

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP community.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server community comm1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete a configured SNMP access group specifying the security model (v2c or v3) it uses. When deleting an SNMPv3 access group, also specify the type of security that the group uses.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to delete an SNMP access group.

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP group that can only access via SNMPv2c.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server group group1 v2c

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP group that can only access via SNMPv3 specifying the security it uses.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server group group-floor2 v3 priv

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete a configured SNMPv3 user.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to delete an SNMPv3 user.

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMPv3 user.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server user user1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete a configured SNMP view specifying the OID tree it is configured to include or exclude.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to delete an SNMP view.

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP view specifying the OID tree it excludes.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server view view2 1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8.9.2

PARAM.name: host-addr
PARAM.help: Host address, IPv4, IPv6 or hostname

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete a configured SNMP IPv4 or IPv6 host.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to delete an SNMP host.

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP IPv4 host.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server host 1.2.3.4

EXAMPLE.summary: Delete an SNMP IPv6 host.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# no snmp-server host 3001::1
